553902BB5C15483CB8F46C84B85B7856.description: Recognize that climates around the world are ever changing, and identify possible explanations.

BE5084B3F4534933B81E4AA14BA13C3B.description: Identify factors that influence weather and climate in Manitoba and across Canada, and describe their impacts.

6F5CC30FC2004544BD1D31287F35678A.description: Identify and describe common cloud formations.

BF0CBBCED8BF427BB73EAFEC3580E1F1.description: Explain how clouds form, and relate cloud formation and precipitation to the water cycle.

1A93247B6C8849B9AD7B463D04AB5EDB.description: Explain how the transfer of energy from the Sun affects weather conditions.

5AF698480F6C4ACEBCD4411CCF37FA3A.description: Describe examples of technological advances that have enabled humans to deepen their scientific understanding of weather and improve the accuracy of weather predictions.

8D3318C752A547F9A96B738E30C1D353.description: Contrast the accuracy of short- and long-term weather forecasts, and discuss possible reasons for the discrepancies.

B4D68FD332E3469A947AC88BDEDA0D93.description: Investigate various ways of predicting weather, and evaluate their usefulness.

8926A37E89BC49B2897E5C2709C79B7B.description: Provide examples of severe weather forecasts, and describe preparations for ensuring personal safety during severe weather and related natural disasters.

826E0EBB79E64D97A5572C9FEE6FF3A3.description: Describe the key features of a variety of weather phenomena.

18CFE1A7822B4AB18F82D7EFE5949195.description: Identify and describe components of public weather reports from a variety of sources.

D599D19E0E484607BB91245154CF8DA2.description: Observe and measure local weather conditions over a period of time, using student-constructed or standard instruments, and record and analyze these data.

847A7B456C534BA482920E93ADAA8A0A.description: Use the design process to construct a weather instrument.

473E6B139B994C47A58FACF691EFA2A1.description: Recognize that warm and cold air masses are important components of weather, and describe what happens when these air masses meet along a front.

AEB48C8D791044209EA3BC269BB55FE9.description: Describe how weather conditions may affect the activities of humans and other animals.

A9C4175BD96942D4AD57E516EE8E88FD.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of weather.

DED68DAF936C4FAF83BD04AF673E106F.description: Use the design process to construct a prototype containing a system of two or more different simple machines that move in a controlled way to perform a specific function.

BF95A352DB964739B89DA7F29175600A.description: Compare devices that use variations of simple machines to accomplish similar tasks.

FBD7CE5B354843D8A3223A7F45073562.description: Investigate to identify advantages and disadvantages of using different simple machines to accomplish the same task.

D7DA0991974D4A819990D15960E65194.description: Describe the advantage of using simple machines to move or lift a given load.

DFD41CDB25564D21B11C5B3932D4C7BC.description: Identify and describe types of simple machines.

DB1EF1A6767140D2A824DCDC936A6FC5.description: Identify and make modifications to their own pulley and/or gear systems to improve how they move loads.

1986D08D2B524558825F224E5BB141DD.description: Compare, quantitatively, the force required to lift a load using a pulley system versus a single fixed pulley, and recognize the relationship between the force required and the distance over which the force is applied.

66FABF57ACF345948BA94B2FA968B6CD.description: Explore to determine how the direction and amount of the applied force and the speed of rotation vary within a two-gear system.

E1E87EF9CBB3433EB0FC2D034CFED861.description: Identify common devices and systems that incorporate pulleys and/or gears.

E1CE83D14201414F9F1D96FB1D06DD87.description: Recognize that a gear is a wheel and axle used to turn another wheel and axle.

026FE0F9D7544F9084C78AAD5A70A071.description: Identify objects in the school and at home that use wheels and axles, and describe the forces involved.

2321CBEE86904760A64186311FF7941B.description: Investigate a variety of levers used to accomplish particular tasks in order to compare them qualitatively with respect to fulcrum position, applied force, and load.

74539EFB20124CBDA52D8E99CC80CCB7.description: Describe, using diagrams, the forces acting on an object and the effects of increasing or decreasing them.

417B3569B48F4BA3BD8ECF46295B11DA.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of forces and simple machines.

68504B1F8AA84C4FA242DA42C8D3EC5A.description: Research and describe how raw materials are transformed into useful products.

92B251A1BA7F43498A92C28845D4F196.description: Evaluate household chemical products using the design process.

E0A345CDBE624130B2384725ACF23C35.description: Identify potentially harmful chemical products used at home, and describe practices to ensure personal safety.

647CBE54160C4C4E886EB101ADC814CB.description: Observe examples of changes in substances, classify them as physical or chemical changes, and justify the designation.

5D7C74FB121849FA81600F450CA82961.description: Recognize that a physical change alters the characteristics of a substance without producing a new substance, and that a chemical change produces a new substance with distinct characteristics and properties.

C1B344F4BB6641AE91CF75A1CF715A3E.description: Explore to identify reversible and non-reversible changes that can be made to substances.

1E449457D424495DACE0A80AA8E48102.description: Demonstrate that changes of state are reversible through the addition or removal of heat.

23DD6F26682549309067280D2D0666B8.description: Demonstrate that the mass/weight of a whole object is equal to the sum of the mass/weight of its parts.

E656C54344AC409B8CF5FEFDCBE8F13A.description: Experiment to compare the mass/weight of a substance in its liquid and solid states.

2E8B4F4480EA4861A4594BAEB8AB5B3B.description: Identify properties of the three states of matter.

F87542AB1E7C4491B5E03C2ED2883EBF.description: Recognize that matter is anything that has mass/weight and takes up space.

34E0A373C2F2411DA1327C8BB78D2DA2.description: Investigate to determine how characteristics and properties of substances may change when they interact with one other.

A6CCF14D381648B7BFAA8009245CE732.description: Identify characteristics and properties that allow substances to be distinguished from one another.

8B8937A5C85A464DB508F5E169E3EE8F.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of properties of, and changes in, substances.

1560D637C687497A93C36F2A55729A98.description: Properties of and Changes in Substances

F906BAE2B29B4032A929756AFB2516E7.description: Explain how human health may be affected by lifestyle choices and natural- and human-caused environmental factors.

5F87DE62861648A5B43A4B87B949A1DA.description: Evaluate information related to body image and health from media sources for science content and bias.

A597FA299D6046BA88931F3607973CBB.description: Identify and describe factors necessary to maintain a healthy body.

5286406D360C495DBB839CB04D8F02A7.description: Give examples of how systems of the human body work together.

3A6FE3105C254C83BA3D3C7E2F4B3A1C.description: Describe how the human body gets rid of waste

1371D68901DB49CE8BBB308EA9FA2AF3.description: Identify the major components of the respiratory and circulatory systems, and describe the role of each system in the human body.

9F7A6566CB7E41B1AAA90ACD9D74A4E5.description: Identify components of the human body’s defenses against infections, and describe their role in defending the body against infection.

C2A0619549E448EC96745761DBC5866E.description: Identify skin as the major component of the integumentary system, and describe its role in protecting and supporting the human body.

2405D8F86BDA4A0584B58A96CD745BDE.description: Identify the major components of the skeletal, muscular, and nervous systems, and describe the role of each system in the human body.

09B25E8086B04050BD50A74380D3BE48.description: Identify the major components of the digestive system, and describe its role in the human body

0EE066EB4EBF4D4A8D61416EAE39F8EC.description: Evaluate prepared food products using the design process.

2D0097C7C8CA4284A2121C96B2676D6C.description: Evaluate a daily menu plan and suggest changes to make it align more closely with Canada’s Food Guide to Healthy Eating.

1ABF3BB7334E4094B660021FE038C5AE.description: Describe the types of nutrients in foods and their function in maintaining a healthy body.

B20DA7B90E8A4DFC910BCCC5BE13EF37.description: Interpret nutritional information found on food labels.

05C2492E36B14E8BAB8624DA583CDC3C.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of human health.

C1035058A7844CC6A2C37A99FFFDCE6E.description: Frequently and thoughtfully evaluate the potential consequences of their actions.

4F0FD3DA8A5040FF814A05329C4D7241.description: Be sensitive to and develop a sense of responsibility for the welfare of other humans, other living things, and the environment.

E636D8624C884561BD6D042137939113.description: Appreciate the importance of creativity, accuracy, honesty, and perseverance as scientific and technological habits of mind.

47D1512A7C424A51B072D0BD9283FD17.description: Demonstrate confidence in their ability to carry out investigations.

C30E71AD945C40FE9FF6128EF12A21BF.description: Show interest in the activities of individuals working in scientific and technological fields.

068FD25148EE45F0915507BCF48E7C3D.description: Appreciate that women and men of diverse cultural backgrounds can contribute equally to science.

6005CA0F0081487FB36E9CBAE133C723.description: Describe positive and negative effects of scientific and technological endeavours.

6D87428D6A41438A8BFE839C68397A9D.description: Recognize that science is organized into specialized disciplines.

1D862010E99F451082E6AE89C6372547.description: Describe hobbies and careers related to science and technology

177C848E5E1E44C3ABCF115B33347969.description: Provide examples of technologies from the past and describe how they have evolved over time.

0EB04DF9C70042CDA8D30AD5B2B6D71B.description: Recognize that technology is a way of solving problems in response to human needs.

1A4C0EB5178846819DBAADEB77FABA1A.description: Identify examples of scientific knowledge that have developed as a result of the gradual accumulation of evidence.

D8CEDCFBC6E4415BBEE6417BA0DD543D.description: Recognize that science is a way of answering questions about the world and that there are questions that science cannot answer.

BA3A372E2A6C42A1BC849134FF0FA572.description: Identify, with guidance, potential applications of investigation results.

B4A201E9B60F44639885FD0AD5E7AF86.description: Communicate methods, results, conclusions, and new knowledge in a variety of ways.

3BB2AA2394CA440BBFED842734CCB0DF.description: Use prior knowledge and experiences selectively to make sense of new information in a variety of contexts.

383A89195C3B4CB4BBA4C5758A331B37.description: Identify new practical problems to solve.

DFDEA19FA94841A5BD46E54000F11239.description: Propose and justify a solution to the initial problem.

92F7B6056DB54388AB9EECDF07ECC8C5.description: Identify, with guidance, a new prediction/hypothesis, based on investigation results.

79D83939265448A981C1CB9ED718356E.description: Base conclusions on evidence rather than preconceived ideas or hunches.

ED45FE4F276E459EA5B0A09D2DEF1295.description: Draw, with guidance, a conclusion that explains investigation results.

F302935DDE7043BB92D61D3EBBD8CBEE.description: Evaluate the methods used to answer a question or solve a problem.

DE55CAE976AE43E681C02D60DE0822FC.description: Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of a consumer product, based on predetermined criteria.

89EFD16D03D24E6FB826AF755F81C9D2.description: Identify and make improvements to a prototype, and explain the rationale for the changes.

3FD0F4A0E0E247D9923F61011ABA6E21.description: Identify and suggest explanations for patterns and discrepancies in data.

65A1F5E2A8E24B54ACD7ECC38497EB9A.description: Construct graphs to display data, and interpret and evaluate these and other graphs.

7FF3259279C3426190F2CEC130F99FC2.description: Record and organize observations in a variety of ways.

83BCEED42CCF4E03A5E1E0A0E32A05F6.description: Estimate and measure mass/weight, length, volume, and temperature using SI and other standard units.

B0F9323F61904DE4BEE3AC0F0B764A1C.description: Evaluate the appropriateness of units and measuring tools in practical contexts.

F2A58361E3F24263B7D98A913BA06F49.description: Select and use tools and instruments to observe, measure, and construct.

2290D9CDBFA04E729579A0722E774786.description: Test a prototype or consumer product, using predetermined criteria.

45F3DD990E6943D3BE35A1FE8ABFBC07.description: Make observations that are relevant to a specific question.

92A899D8A00A46AB8AAC895E5B7DCFBC.description: Use tools and materials in a manner that ensures personal safety and the safety of others.

90246CC5235B43349F00AA95A1F2669C.description: Assume various roles and share responsibilities as group members.

9AB5DA0302684FDAB0A84B41B28AA87B.description: Work cooperatively with group members to carry out a plan, and troubleshoot problems as they arise.

3004E3D14E05492F8CBC9C153CF5BDFE.description: Carry out, with guidance, procedures that comprise a fair test.

071A27BFC3214C8C8C5DC9650C1DD3E1.description: Create a written plan to solve a problem.

05B1FDDB771049F2A2AF62ED516BAB99.description: Develop criteria to evaluate a prototype or consumer product.

A88588AE7A9645BABB756AFEDE3C5076.description: Create a written plan to answer a specific question.

85AD017F4C39454A8C3373C253A93495.description: Identify variables that might have an impact on their experiments and, with guidance, variables to hold constant to ensure a fair test.

F22D90C0C647416BA082962C7EE8975B.description: Formulate, with guidance, a prediction/hypothesis that identifies a cause and effect relationship.

A8B6C53DD9C044A9B53B370707606EE1.description: Record information in own words and reference sources appropriately.

8E7F65C8B93249309E0E63D0F185F829.description: Review information to determine its usefulness, using predetermined criteria.

89CF2215482E4300A2932E14F02A7C98.description: Access information using a variety of sources.

FCD74201FE324EB996D23B8C77B4B2EA.description: Identify various methods to solve a practical problem, and select and justify one to implement.

18569E6440D5454EB17DAFF39EF30206.description: Identify various methods for finding the answer to a specific question and, with guidance, select one to implement.

48947737B8784381BDDCDBA79FC35E5A.description: Formulate, with guidance, specific questions that lead to investigations
